column4: Feisty sits on my 2nd HDD, but Grub sits on my 1st HDD.  How can I install Grub on my 2nd HDD instead and then boot Ubuntu directly from 2nd HDD?  Anyone know pleasse?
<stefg> lisapc: bios boots first HD, no matter where you install grub... no way <-- yes way! LOL.  I can boot directly from my 2nd HDD
can anyone tell me whats the command to install Grub onto my 2nd HDD?
try asking in #grub
I did ask in grub
as a general rule I beleive you need to have grub install to which ever the boot drive is,  there woudn't be much point in having it install on another drive

you are dead wrong!  during POST, I press ESC and it gives me option to boot directly from first OR second hdd.  And I had edgy boot from 2nd HDD before.  So even if I took out my 1st hdd, I could still boot Ubuntu from 2nd hdd
and thats a great idea in case of first hdd failure. this way I can still boot Ubuntu from 2nd hdd!  THINK before you speak ;)
LOL
easy fix and it solves your problem
what fix?
u gave no fix
unplug the first hdd and install grub
ROFL!  think before you speak man
think, deeply, think
I do nothing but
you think, but you dont reason the thoughts, hence the reason your words are not coherent
I figured it out!  was easy.  I simply removed grub from 1st HDD, and then "sudo grub-install /dev/sdb" which installs it on my 2nd HDD.  I now dont even need the 1st HDD to load Ubuntu. :)
make a note of what I did for your future refence
Grub and everything is on my 2nd external HDD now
good for you,  I am in awe of your 1337ness
and I am in awe of your ignorance :)
